title: Customize Claude's Behavior
description: Learn to add rules and preferences to CLAUDE.md that change how Claude Code behaves in your project.

initialFiles.content:
# Challenge: Customize Claude's Behavior

Your team has specific coding standards. Configure Claude Code to follow them.

## Objectives
1. Add coding style preferences to CLAUDE.md
2. Specify that TypeScript should be used
3. Add rules about error handling

# My Project

A web application built with Node.js.

## Commands
- `npm run dev` - Start development server
- `npm run build` - Build for production

hints.text: Add a section to CLAUDE.md with coding preferences and rules Claude should follow.
Try: 'Update CLAUDE.md to specify we use TypeScript and add rules for error handling'
Ask: 'Update CLAUDE.md to add: 1) A coding standards section 2) Rule to always use TypeScript (.ts, .tsx files) 3) Rule to wrap async operations in try/catch 4) Prefer explicit types over any'

solution.approach: Add sections to CLAUDE.md with specific rules and preferences.
solution.example: Update CLAUDE.md with TypeScript requirements and error handling rules
alternativeApproaches: Add coding standards to the project documentation
Configure Claude to follow team conventions

learningPoints: CLAUDE.md rules directly influence Claude's code generation
Be specific about what you want (and don't want)
Rules like 'always use TypeScript' are followed consistently
